natural problem: If $\pi=3.1415926...$, what is the exact value of $|\pi-3.14|+|\pi-\frac{22}{7}|$? Express your answer as a common fraction.
natural solution: Since $\pi>3.14$, we know that $\pi-3.14>0$, and so $|\pi-3.14|=\pi-3.14$. Also, since $\pi<22/7=3.\overline{142857}$, we have $|\pi-\frac{22}{7}|=\frac{22}{7}-\pi$. The exact value of the sum is \begin{align}

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes pi_approx :: real
assumes h0 : "pi_approx = 3.1415926"
shows  "abs(pi_approx - 3.14) + abs(pi_approx - 22 / 7) = 1 / 350"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 If $\pi=3.1415926...$, what is the exact value of $|\pi-3.14|+|\pi-\frac{22}{7}|$? Express your answer as a common fraction. The final Answer is \frac{1}{350}
 ### Proof
 Since $\pi>3.14$, we know that $\pi-3.14>0$, and so $|\pi-3.14|=\pi-3.14$. Also, since $\pi<22/7=3.\overline{142857}$, we have $|\pi-\frac{22}{7}|=\frac{22}{7}-\pi$. The exact value of the sum is \begin{align}
 |\pi-3.14|+\left|\pi-\frac{22}{7}\right|&=\pi-3.14+\frac{22}{7}-\pi \\ &=\frac{22}{7}-3.14 \\ &=\frac{22}{7}-\frac{314}{100} \\ &=\frac{2200}{700}-\frac{7(314)}{700} \\ &=\frac{2200-2198}{700}\\ &=\frac{2}{700}\\
 &=\boxed{\frac{1}{350}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes pi_approx :: real
assumes h0 : "pi_approx = 3.1415926"
shows  "abs(pi_approx - 3.14) + abs(pi_approx - 22 / 7) = 1 / 350"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Let the approximation of pi be 3.1415926. Find the sum of the absolute differences between this approximation and 3.14 and between this approximation and 22/7. The final answer is 1/350.
